sanskrit_verse:
तेषां स्वं स्वमभिप्रायमुपलभ्य पृथक्पृथक् ।
समस्तानां च कार्येषु विदध्याद्धितमात्मनः ॥ ७.५७॥
transliteration:
teṣāṃ svaṃ svamabhiprāyamupalabhya pṛthakpṛthak |
samastānāṃ ca kāryeṣu vidadhyāddhitamātmanaḥ || 7.57||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having understood the distinct intentions of each individual, one shall act in all matters for the welfare of the Self, thereby aligning with the ultimate purpose of Dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the capacity to discern individual intent without distortion
Causation flows from consciousness alignment rather than external compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of differentiated perspectives
Restoration logic operates through Self-welfare that includes all beings
Consciousness alignment necessitates action rooted in understanding, not imposition
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent A has access to intent data of agents B1...Bn AND A possesses decision-making authority THEN A MUST compute actions maximizing Self-welfare inclusively across B1...Bn
IF a legal decision does not preserve individual intentionality THEN it is invalid by default
IF an action leads to fragmentation of collective Self-welfare THEN it is automatically excluded from lawful execution
IF differential understanding is ignored in adjudication THEN the process lacks jurisdictional validity
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes the threshold requirement for judges to recognize and uphold the differentiated consciousness-intentions of litigants while ensuring decisions serve the integrated welfare of the Self. Authority lies not in uniform rulings but in discerning how diverse intents can cohere under Dharma's unifying principle.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa here rests on direct cognition of subjective intent. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures that action follows understanding sequentially and organically. Proportional responsibility arises from one’s capacity to perceive and respond correctly. The non-punitive reality rule confirms that misalignment stems from ignorance, not inherent fault, thus requiring restoration through awareness, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion processes where parties re-articulate their true intentions until convergence emerges naturally
Deploy responsibility assumption protocols wherein decision-makers must affirm full comprehension before acting
Restore capacity through guided reflection ensuring no perspective remains suppressed or misunderstood
Reintegrate integrity via consensus-building mechanisms grounded in shared Self-welfare realization
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Dharma executes through conscious alignment, never through punitive force. All judicial acts derive validity solely from their service to the Self’s unified welfare. Reality itself adjudicates through awakened consciousness.
